intro: Clermontia convallis, commonly known as the Mauna Kea laukahi, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of forests, often at high elevations. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its restricted habitat and threats from habitat loss, Clermontia convallis is considered endangered.
